result.execSummary:
The defendant Policarpio Villanueva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Villanueva  to  2 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to case #13CF279 and to any other sentence in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling  as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of any non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to undergo random UA's as required by the Agent
--no presence at Breselows Market or the Pick N Save Market in Watertown
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in uncharged referrals for Disorderly Conduct in Watertown WI on 1/22/14 (DA Case #14JE194), for Criminal Damage to Property in Watertown WI on 1/24/14 (DA Case #14JE419), and for Retail Theft in Watertown WI on 1/26/14 (DA Case #14JE3303, and thereafter bars further prosecution of these referrals.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 9:46am.
Defendant Policarpio  Villanueva in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Villanueva guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in uncharged referrals for Disorderly Conduct in Watertown WI on 1/22/14 (DA Case #14JE194), for Criminal Damage to Property in Watertown WI on 1/24/14 (DA Case #14JE419), and for Retail Theft in Watertown WI on 1/26/14 (DA Case #14JE3303, and thereafter bars further prosecution of these referrals. 

The Court sentences Mr. Villanueva  to  2 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to case #13CF279 and to any other sentence in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling  as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of any non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to undergo random UA's as required by the Agent
--no presence at Breselows Market or the Pick N Save Market in Watertown
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:00am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

case called at 9:42am. 
Defendant Policarpio  Villanueva appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa, appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Attorney De La Rosa requests that the case be scheduled for Plea & Sentencing on a date after May 8th;  the Defense has submitted a counter-offer to the State, and is hoping to reach a stipulated agreement; but if not, the intent is still to proceed to change-of-plea, and have argued sentence recommendations.
recess 9:42am. 

NEXT:  schedule Plea/Sentencing on a date after May 8th

Case called at 1:44 pm
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet. Court finds that there is no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court based on this record does not set a bond in this file.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Court orders that the warrant in this case has been executed since the defendant has appeared in court, and that the warrant should be withdrawn from any system.

Recess: 1:52 pm
